Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • duchess.logic.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Core class for a game.

      • promotePawn

        private Piece promotePawn(Piece p)
        Promotes a pawn if on the right rank at the opposing side.
        Parameters:
        p - Pawn to promote
        Returns:
        New piece (Queen)

      • updateEnPassant

        private Piece updateEnPassant()
        Updates the status of a possible en passant move. If the move can be done, changes the corresponding attribute in the right pawn.
        Returns:
        The piece capable of en passant, and if none, null.

      • addPiece

        public Piece addPiece(java.lang.String className,
             int pieceID,
             Square s,
             boolean color)
        Adds a piece to the chessboard. Makes sure that square is valid and not occupied.
        Parameters:
        className - Type of piece as String, e.g. "Pawn"
        s - Square in which to place piece
        color - True for white, false for black
        Returns:
        true for success

      • addPiece

        public boolean addPiece(Piece p)
        Adds an existing Piece to the chessboard.
        Parameters:
        p - Piece
        Returns:
        true for success

      • move

        public boolean move(Piece p,
           Square square)
        Moves a piece on the chessboard. If the input move is legal, the piece is moved to target square. If the square is occupied by an opponent, the opponent's piece is captured. The move can result in a check or mate. A move ends the players turn.
        Parameters:
        p - Piece
        square - Square to move to.
        Returns:
        Returns false if piece is null or piece has no possible moves. On success returns true.

      • move

        public boolean move(int pieceIndex,
           Square square)

      • castlingMove

        private boolean castlingMove(Piece p,
                   Square move)
        Makes a castling move.
        Parameters:
        p - Piece to move
        move - Square to move to
        Returns:
        true for success (when called from move() it can not fail)

      • whoIsAt

        public Piece whoIsAt(Square s)
        Return the piece occupying a Square.
        Parameters:
        s - Square
        Returns:
        Piece or null if Square not occupied

      • whoCanMoveHere

        public Piece[] whoCanMoveHere(Square s,
                     boolean opponent,
                     boolean excludeKings)
        Returns which pieces are capable of moving to the input square. Note: only concerns the player who can move at the turn in question.
        Parameters:
        s - Square
        opponent - if true, return returns opponent's pieces
        excludeKings - leave kings out of this (needed for resolving check)
        Returns:
        Array of Pieces

      • canXsMoveHere

        public Piece[] canXsMoveHere(java.lang.String className,
                    Square sq,
                    Piece caller,
                    boolean opponent)
        Returns pieces of specified type who can move to square.
        Parameters:
        className - class name of the piece in question
        opponent - if true, return returns opponent's pieces
        Returns:

      • pieceHasID

        Returns the piece corresponding to a pieceID.
        Parameters:
        i - pieceID
        Returns:
